name: John F. O'Donnell
bio: John F. O'Donnell (JFOD) is currently a 'Political Correspondent' on the comedy news television program 'Redacted Tonight w/ Lee Camp' on RT America. According to the Comedy Central Insider, "John F. O'Donnell is one of the more explosive comics in New York City. On stage, he's like a tightly capped liter of soda filled with lit fireworks." John has been featured in The New York Times, The LA Times and The Huffington Post, as well as being one of Comedy Central's Fresh Faces of Comedy. He has performed at a number of comedy festivals around the country and beyond, including The Bridgetown Comedy Festival, The Edinburgh Fringe Festival, The New York Comedy Festival, The Limestone Comedy Festival, The Bentzen Ball Comedy Festival, and The New Orleans Hell Yes Festival. He's been a favorite guest on the popular podcasts Keith and The Girl, You Made It Weird w/ Pete Holmes, You Had To Be There w/ Nikki & Sara, and Skeptic Tank w/ Ari Shaffir. John is also the co-creator and host of the 7-city hit show, 50 First Jokes. He recently performed a week of shows in Germany, where he headlined at the prestigious 'English Theatre Berlin.' John has also performed at the legendary 'JFK Center For The Performing Arts,' and has been interviewed by Larry King. For real! WTF?! He has almost 3 hours of stand up material available for digital download through his website.
